T0001 ta та TA Pron. of second person singular and plural ( in polite address); used in plural sense only in connection with other indication of plurality, -- bygyde. All of you, you all. -- bykyn. All of you, you all. -- nar. You (polite address to a group of people). -- xojar. You two, you both.

T0001 ta -т TA, TE Suffix added to cardinal numerals and the words olan "many" and kedyn "how many" to form multiplicatives with the meaning of "[so many] times"; in old texts it is sometimes written separately bi tegyn dy kedynte kelegsen bolbacu sonusuγsan ygei Although I have told him several times, he did hot listen. γurbanta josulaxu. To salute three times kedynte. Several times; how many times? kedynte kyrygsen bolbacu ucirazu cidaγsan ygei. Althgugh [I] went there several times, [I] was unable to meet him. olanta. T0004 taI - dei
TAI, 1 - TEI [ cf. tu / ty ] Suffix of the comitative with the following functions: a) It expresses the idea of "together with, in company with" b) It expresses possession, association, or connection with, or means "characterized or qualified by," etc. It is used both attributively and predicatively. In attributive position it is interchangeable with tu/ ty. c) By extension it shows that something is within a container (interchangeable with tu/ty). d) Expresses age after numerals. casu tai boruyan tai xoliyad oruzu bain-a. It is snowing and raining at the same time. ekener tel keyked tei ben jabuzu bain-a. [I, etc.] was going with [my, etc.] wife and children. nada tai ire! Come with me! aziltai edyr.
